content.question: A system consists of a horizontal rod and two small objects, as shown. The horizontal rod has a total length <math alttext="2 l sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="script">l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and mass <math alttext="uppercase M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, with rotational inertia <math alttext="I sub R equals the fraction uppercase M I squared over 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>M</mi><msup><mrow><mi>l</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Each object has a mass <math alttext="lowercase m sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and a rotational inertia <math alttext="I sub O equals lowercase m sub 0 end sub, r squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> where <math alttext="r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the distance from the object to the axle. The objects are fixed to the rod at the positions shown in the figure. The system is initially at rest, and a net torque is exerted on the system until it rotates with an angular speed, <math alttext="omega sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>ω</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> about the vertical axis shown, which is through the center of the rod. What is the change in the angular momentum of the system from when the system was at rest to the instant when the net torque is no longer applied to the system?
